author: Times Of India
title: Mandala season concludes, nearly 33L devotees visit shrine | Kochi News - Times of India
text: Kottayam: The Mandala festival at the Sabarimala temple concluded on Thursday. Over 32.50 lakh devotees had darshan during the Mandala festival season. The Mandala puja was held between 12 noon and 12.30pm on Thursday. The sanctum sanctorum was closed after Harivarasanam at night.The temple will be opened again for the Makaravilakku festival on Dec 30. The Makaravilakku is on Jan 14. By Wednesday, 32,49,756 devotees had darshan. Compared to last year, there is an increase of 4,07,309 pilgrims. Around 5,66,571 pilgrims made use of the live booking facility during this period.On Wednesday, the day when the Thanka Anki procession reached Sabarimala, 62,877 devotees had darshan. Among these, 9,773 arrived using the live booking system. By 12 noon on Thursday, 19,968 devotees arrived at Sabarimala through virtual and live booking systems. Of these, 4,106 came through the live booking system.According to the details available till Wednesday, 74,764 devotees arrived via Pullumedu for darshan. During the same period last year, 69,250 arrived through this route.Devaswom minister V N Vasavan said that darshan was ensured for all the devotees who arrived during the Mandala festival season. Even on days when over a lakh devotees arrived at Sabarimala, not a single person had to return without having darshan, he said. He also said that creating a situation that enabled 85-90 devotees climbing the Pathinettam Padi every minute enabled this. Compared to last year, an excess of five lakh devotees arrived during this period this year, the minister said. He also said that according to the unofficially available details, the revenue during this period is Rs 28cr more than that of the previous year. Meanwhile, the meeting in connection with the preparations for the Makaravilakku festival, which was slated to be held on Thursday, has been postponed to Dec 28 following the demise of M T Vasudevan Nair.
